newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana stock indicators rise but mood bearish.
newsitem.headline: Ghana stock indicators rise but mood bearish.

text.p: Ghana stock indicators rose on a good gain by Ashanti Goldfields Co on Wednesday but dealers said concern about general economic conditions was keeping sentiment bearish.
The GSE All-Share Index climbed 0.41 points to 380.72 and total market capitalisation rose to 3,292.06 billion cedis from 3,282.29 billion, results showed.
"High interest rates and general economic conditions are affecting equity investment," one broker said.
Market analysts said the central bank's 45 percent interest rate was high enough to slow the economy and hurt corporate earnings.
Ashanti Goldfields climbed 100 to 30,000 cedis, Ghana Commercial Bank was up three at 723 cedis and Social Security Bank and Fan Milk rose two cedis apiece to 1,032 and 377 cedis respectively.
Unilever slipped five cedis to 800 and UTC-Estates was two lower at 60.
Offers exceeded bids by 1,090,250 shares to 170,450 and turnover was a low 17,350 shares.
"We are waiting to see what will happen in subsequent sessions, which will be a test period for market volumes," an analyst said.
He predicted the bearish situation would last for some time.
